data.title: Updated implementation of Texture2D.GetData<T> using subregion for MacOS and DirectX
data.body: Texture2D.GetData<T> threw NotImplementedExceptions on both MacOS and DirectX if you supplied a Rectangle as the Source area. I have implemented that functionality for both platforms.

data.title: Re-enabled windows installer build for windows machines
data.body: As the title says

data.title: Fix for iOS Orientation on iOS6+
data.body:
When using Guide.BeginShowKeyboardInput and having both Landscape Left
and Right orientations enabled, this method was forcing the orientation
of the presented KeyboardInputViewController to be LandscapeRight, even
if the current orientation was different. Now the code tries to keep the
current orientation. If this is not possible, only then it will try to
force Right, then Left and then Portrait.

data.title: Place cursor at end in Android KeyboardInput
data.body: When using Guide.ShowKeyboardInput on Android, the cursor was placed at the beginning of the default text in the input field. This patch puts it at the end of the input, which is more user-friendly.

data.title: Game.OnActivate called twice during initialization in Windows GL
data.body:
Here are the two paths that initiate the Game.OnActivate:

```
MonoGame.Framework.dll!Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GamePlatform.Raise<System.EventArgs>(System.EventHandler<System.EventArgs> handler, System.EventArgs e) Line 228 + 0x11 bytes    C#
MonoGame.Framework.dll!Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GamePlatform.IsActive.set(bool value) Line 149 + 0x4c bytes  C#
MonoGame.Framework.dll!Microsoft.Xna.Framework.OpenTKGamePlatform.ResetWindowBounds(bool toggleFullScreen) Line 256 + 0xb bytes C#
MonoGame.Framework.dll!Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game.ResizeWindow(bool changed) Line 713 + 0x42 bytes    C#

MonoGame.Framework.dll!Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GamePlatform.Raise<System.EventArgs>(System.EventHandler<System.EventArgs> handler, System.EventArgs e) Line 228 + 0x11 bytes    C#
MonoGame.Framework.dll!Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GamePlatform.IsActive.set(bool value) Line 149 + 0x4c bytes  C#
MonoGame.Framework.dll!Microsoft.Xna.Framework.OpenTKGamePlatform.ResetWindowBounds(bool toggleFullScreen) Line 256 + 0xb bytes C#
MonoGame.Framework.dll!Microsoft.Xna.Framework.OpenTKGamePlatform.ExitFullScreen() Line 188 + 0xa bytes C#
MonoGame.Framework.dll!Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game.applyChanges(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GraphicsDeviceManager manager) Line 667 + 0xe bytes    C#
```

data.title: SharpDX Update
data.body:
This is an update to the latest SharpDX changes as of [May 22nd commit](https://github.com/sharpdx/SharpDX/commit/e2b20da5885e73b9801b66034a74f4dcd23950c1).

Since SharpDX underwent some API changes there are a few fixes associated with it here too.

data.title: How to build MonoDevelop AddIn on GNU/Linux?
data.body:
I'm unable to find any documentation on how to build the MonoDevelop AddIn for Linux.

The addin.xml references dlls in the assemblies directory, but it by default adds all platforms.
Seems the main files added are the ones in the WindowsGL directory.

It would be great if someone could write a short instruction for building the addin.

Thanks.

data.title: Issue #1775 - Added async calls per nezz's advice.
data.body: Added sync calls around the mediaPlayer interface calls that were causing thread issues for us.

From a user on the monogame IRC channel:

a good wiki page that describes the default inputs and outputs as well as the shader/vertex models supported by various platforms would be useful

data.title: Song.Duration and MediaPlayer.PlayPosition bug
data.body:
Hi,

There is a bug when you try to get TotalMilliseconds from anySong.Duration and MediaPlayer.PlayPosition. MonoGame Android returns a number 1000 times bigger than XNA. I didn't test this issue on other devices. Here are my tests on anySong.Duration :

== SONG 1
XNA PC : 120696
Mono Android : 120409000

== SONG 2
XNA PC : 217942
Mono Android : 217940000

data.body: I think ContentManager is not friendly for manager texture2d resource. i want to use Textue2D.FromStream load Texture from image file.but it's not Implemented. some one can implement the methond?

data.title: Cross-thread access violation during OnActivated
data.body:
Just put cocos2d-xna on windows phone 8. Did the startup, and in game_Activated from the Game.OnActivated event, we query the MediaPlayer.PlayPosition. This throws an UnauthorizedAccessException in MediaPlayer.PlayPosition { _mediaElement.Position }. We are not forking any threads in our app in this case, so either the app needs to block on the UI thread when it check the MediaPlayer state during OnActivated, or else MonoGame should do that in the MediaPlayer class. Here is the exception trace:

```
MonoGame.Framework.DLL!Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Media.MediaPlayer.PlayPosition.get() Line 218    C#
```

>   cocos2d-xna.DLL!CocosDenshion.CCMusicPlayer.SaveMediaState() Line 65    C#
>     cocos2d-xna.DLL!CocosDenshion.CCSimpleAudioEngine.SaveMediaState() Line 98  C#
>     cocos2d-xna.DLL!Cocos2D.CCApplication.game_Activated(object sender, System.EventArgs e) Line 156    C#
>     MonoGame.Framework.DLL!Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game.Raise<System.EventArgs>(System.EventHandler<System.EventArgs> handler, System.EventArgs e) Line 789 C#
>     MonoGame.Framework.DLL!Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game.OnActivated(object sender, System.EventArgs args) Line 607  C#
>     MonoGame.Framework.DLL!Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GamePlatform.Raise<System.EventArgs>(System.EventHandler<System.EventArgs> handler, System.EventArgs e) Line 228 C#
>     MonoGame.Framework.DLL!Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GamePlatform.IsActive.set(bool value) Line 149   C#
>     MonoGame.Framework.DLL!Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GamePlatform.BeforeInitialize() Line 253 C#
>     MonoGame.Framework.DLL!Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game.DoInitialize() Line 700 C#
>     MonoGame.Framework.DLL!Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game.Run(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GameRunBehavior runBehavior) Line 425   C#
>     MonoGame.Framework.DLL!MonoGame.Framework.WindowsPhone.XamlGame<TestWin8Phone.Game1>.SurfaceUpdateHandler.Draw(SharpDX.Direct3D11.Device device, SharpDX.Direct3D11.DeviceContext context, SharpDX.Direct3D11.RenderTargetView renderTargetView) Line 101   C#

data.title: should update sharpdx version to 2.5
data.body: sharpdx can not support DrawingSurface element,and DrawingSurfaceBackgroundGrid cannot support Landscape on WP8.

data.title: BoundingFrustum Improvement
data.body:
This small change prevents this...

```
BoundingFrustum frustum(myMatrix);
frustum.Matrix = proj1;  // Currently generates garbage
```

From generating garbage on every frame.

data.title: Sampler State Fix
data.body: Contains fix for shaders that would sample textures using texobject.Sample() rather than tex2D(texSampler, texCoord).

data.title: memory leak when Resume game
data.body: I think in method ContentManger.ReloadGraphicsContent memory leak when resume game. every times lost 20M.

data.title: GraphicsDevice.DrawUserPrimitives() not applying texture from BasicEffect
[Linux] Window bounds not reset on fullscreen.
data.body:
The issue looks to be right here. https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Desktop/OpenTKGamePlatform.cs#L183

The parameter here should be true. 

Right now, what it's doing, is making a 640x480 box in the lower left corner that is usable. The origin for this box is in its upper left corner.

![Illustration](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1864940/607496/6197207c-cd45-11e2-9ef1-a6fa72df18e5.png)

data.title: Possibly adding support for command line games
data.body: Just wondering what everyone would think about adding support for command line/terminal games. Would this be something be a possible direction MonoGame would like to go or should we just stay away from this idea?

data.title: Added GraphicsDevice.SetVertexBuffers()
data.body:
Added VertexBufferBinding.cs.

Needs extensive testing as this touches all vertex buffer code in GraphicsDevice.

data.title: [WinDX] Song loading issue
data.body:
Loading a song results in the thread becoming locked/blocked after the call to 

resolver.CreateObjectFromURL(FilePath, (int)SourceResolverFlags.MediaSource, null, out otype, out source);

on line 197 of Song.cs.

The game does not load and the window stays frozen (no exceptions are thrown either).

Edit: I am just using the basic Content.Load[Song] with a XNA game studio compiled XNB (with a .wma tied next to it in the physical directory).

data.title: [WinDX] Audio issue
data.body:
I'm getting a:

$exception  {"HRESULT: [0x80040154], Module: [Unknown], ApiCode: [Unknown/Unknown], Message: Class not registered\r\n"} System.Exception {SharpDX.SharpDXException}

When my game tries to enable Audio for my game.

I traced the exception and it throws (and catches without any warning surprisingly) at line 478 of SoundEffect.cs (in the static constructor).

This line causes the error: Device = new XAudio2(flags, ProcessorSpecifier.DefaultProcessor);

I have no idea on how to proceed because I do not know how XAudio2 works or what "Class not registered" means.

I'm sure this would have been picked up if Audio could not be played at all so is this a error on my part? Any help would be greatly appreciated.

data.title: Fix for missing MediaElement on WP8 template.
Added setting of the touch panel orientation during the GraphicsDeviceManager init
data.body: only the touch panel dimensions were set during init, and this PR sets the orientation as well.

data.title: GraphicsDevice is null during Game construction after ApplyChanges()
GamePage.cs in the installer template uses XnaSurface instead of 'this'
data.body:
In the Windows Phone 8 installer template for VS2012, the GamePage.cs template produces a line:

```
        _game = XamlGame<Game1>.Create("", XnaSurface);
```

This is no longer valid in the current develop branch. The correct line should be:

```
        _game = XamlGame<Game1>.Create("", this);
```

data.title: Fix for issue #1758 - Drawing SpriteFonts to multiple RenderTarget2Ds consecutively leads to all but the first render target missing the text (WindowsGL)
data.body:
Added a call to Textures.Dirty() in GraphicsDevice.ApplyRenderTargets(...). 

Fixes a bug in OpenGL versions where drawing a texture to multiple render targets one after the other would only produce visible results in the first render target drawn to.

Issue: https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/1758
